poem:
The Drummer's Echo

In the grooved record's 
hum, past the clatter  
of cymbals and static  
stories unfold—  
a memoir of rhythms  
brushed with time,  
the beat beneath  
fame's confetti.  
Honest as skin,  
each drumbeat a pulse—  
dulled by memory,  
yet striking, clear—  
the flesh of truth  
laid bare.
